1.name: All Quiet on the Western Front
1.description: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

2.name: Hell's Angels
2.description: Brothers Monte and Ray leave Oxford to join the Royal Flying Corps. Ray loves Helen; Helen enjoys an affair with Monte; before they leave on their mission over Germany they find her in still another man's arms.

3.name: The Big Trail
3.description: Breck Coleman leads hundreds of settlers in covered wagons from the Mississippi River to their destiny out West.

4.name: Der blaue Engel
4.description: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

5.name: L'âge d'or
5.description: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love with each other, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

6.name: Murder!
6.description: A juror in a murder trial, after voting to convict, has second thoughts and begins to investigate on his own before the execution.

7.name: Morocco
7.description: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the results of his womanizing and due to the appearance of a rich man who wants her for himself.

8.name: Animal Crackers
8.description: Mayhem and zaniness ensue when a valuable painting goes missing during a party in honor of famed African explorer Captain Spaulding.

9.name: Little Rascals: Best of Our Gang
9.description: Spanky, Buckwheat, Porky and all The Little Rascals at their hilarious best!

10.name: New Moon
10.description: New Moon is the name of the ship crossing the Caspian Sea. A young Lt. Petroff meets the Princess Tanya and they have a ship board romance. Upon arriving at the port of Krasnov, Petroff ...                See full summary »

11.name: Menschen am Sonntag
11.description: Edwin, a taxi driver, lives with Annie, a neurasthenic model. They plan to spend Sunday at the Nikolassee beach with Wolfgang, an officer, gentleman, antiquarian, gigolo, at the moment a ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Big House
12.description: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.

13.name: Ladies of Leisure
13.description: An upper-crust artist hires a 'party girl' as a model; romance follows.

14.name: The Divorcee
14.description: When a woman discovers that her husband has been unfaithful to her, she decides to respond to his infidelities in kind.

15.name: Anna Christie
15.description: A young woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but struggles to tell them about her dark past.

16.name: Holiday
16.description: Holiday is a 1930 American Pre-Code romantic comedy film which tells the story of a young man who is torn between his free-thinking lifestyle and the tradition of his wealthy fiancée's family.

17.name: Westfront 1918: Vier von der Infanterie
17.description: A group of German infantrymen of the First World War live out their lives in the trenches of France. They find brief entertainment and relief in a village behind the lines, but primarily ...                See full summary »

18.name: Madam Satan
18.description: Angela and Bob Brooks are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, Bob is an unfaithful husband. But Angela has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to ...                See full summary »

19.name: Sous les toits de Paris
19.description: Albert is smitten for Pola but ends up wrongly committed in jail, in the meantime her affections are sought after by his friend, and on his release both love and friendship must be tested.

20.name: What Men Want
20.description: A playboy's mistress falls in love with another man. Her younger sister arrives in town. Complications ensue.

21.name: Up the River
21.description: When paroled trustee Steve and former inmate Judy who try to put their criminal lives behind them are blackmailed, two career criminals come to their rescue.

22.name: Abraham Lincoln
22.description: An episodic biography of the 16th President of the United States.

23.name: The Doorway to Hell
23.description: Despite his efforts to go straight, a young gangster keeps falling back into crime.

24.name: Journey's End
24.description: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.

25.name: Juno and the Paycock
25.description: During the Irish Civil War in 1922, a family earns a big inheritance. They start leading a rich life, forgetting what the most important values are.

26.name: The Dawn Patrol
26.description: World War I ace Dick Courtney derides the leadership of his superior officer, but Courtney is soon promoted to squadron commander and learns harsh lessons about sending subordinates to their deaths.

27.name: Fast and Loose
27.description: A wealthy family is thrown into turmoil when the daughter falls for the family chauffeur and the son begins to keep company with a chorus girl.

28.name: Just Imagine
28.description: New York, 1980: airplanes have replaced cars, numbers have replaced names, pills have replaced food, government-arranged marriages have replaced love, and test tube babies have replaced ......                See full summary »

31.name: Zemlya
31.description: In the peaceful countryside, Vassily opposes the rich kulaks over the coming of collective farming.

32.name: Safety in Numbers
32.description: A songwriter hires three chorus girls to show him the "underside" of big-city life.

33.name: City Girl
33.description: A Chicago waitress falls in love with a Minnesota farmer, and decides to face a life in the country.

34.name: The Bat Whispers
34.description: A master criminal terrorizes the occupants of an isolated country mansion.

35.name: Let Us Be Gay

37.description: Mary Turner goes up for three years on a crime she didn't commit. Once out she and former prison mates plan a scam in which old men can be sued for breach of promise - the "heart balm" ...                See full summary »

38.name: The Florodora Girl
38.description: The married friends of a New York chorus girl encourage her to pursue a handsome but poor socialite.

41.name: Feet First
41.description: An ambitious shoe salesman unknowingly meets his boss' daughter and tells her he is a leather tycoon, then has to try to hide his true circumstances.

42.name: Romance

43.description: Dowdy Sylvia accepts her boss' marriage proposal, even though he only asked her to avoid marriage to another woman. As a wealthy wife, Sylvia changes from ugly duckling to uninhibited swan ...                See full summary »

44.name: Framed
44.description: Woman swears revenge against an Inspector who was responsible for her father's death.

45.name: Min and Bill
45.description: Min, the owner of a dockside hotel, is forced to make difficult decisions about the future of Nancy, the young woman she took in as an infant.

46.name: Billy the Kid

48.description: Three department store girls--Connie, Franky, and Jerry--share an apartment on West 91st Street in New York City. Each earns little more than 20 dollars per week. Jerry is the sensible one,...                See full summary »

49.name: Alraune
49.description: A scientist, Professor Jakob ten Brinken, interested in the laws of heredity, impregnates a prostitute in a laboratory with the semen of a hanged murderer. The prostitute conceives a female...                See full summary »

50.name: Laughter
50.description: A former chorus girl weds a millionaire after the composer she loves leaves. Meanwhile, she strings along an artist in love with her. When the composer returns, she struggles with her needs for security vs love. High jinks and drama ensue.
